citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Land Quality
citeinfo.title: CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN: Confined Feeding Operation Facilities in Indiana (Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Point Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Land Quality

citeinfo.othercit:
This data set was originally provided to personnel of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey (IGWS) by Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Land Quality personnel on August 16, 2002. It has been subsequently updated on January 14, 2003, July 11, 2003, June 3, 2004, January 4, 2005, April 25, 2005, July 27, 2006, January 24, 2007, June 4, 2009, April 16, 2010, June 25, 2013, February 25, 2015, and October 19, 2018.
For more information about Confined Feeding Operations (CFOs) and Concnetrated Animal Feeding Operations (CAFOs), please visit the following IDEM Web site: https://www.in.gov/idem/cfo/2344.htm

descript.abstract:
CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP contains 1,837 locations of all regulated animal confined feeding operations (CFO) in Indiana, provided by personnel of Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Land Quality (IDEM, OLQ). IDEM personnel provided these upated data on October 19, 2018, as an Esri point shapefile named "IDEM_CFO.SHP." Attributes include farm size (CFO versus CAFO), site name, identification numbers (IDEM), address information, NPDES information, and number and types of animals handled.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source shapefile IDEM_CFO.SHP:
"This dataset consists of Confined Feeding Operations - i.e. A swine, chicken, turkey, beef or dairy agri-business that has large enough numbers of animals that IDEM regulates for environmental concerns, as defined by IC 13-18-10 of the Indiana Code.
"CFO - All regulated animal feeding operations in Indiana are considered 'confined feeding operations' (CFO). To be regulated under the 'Confined Feeding Control Law' in Indiana, you must meet the following size of any one livestock group listed below:
"300 or more cattle
"600 or more swine or sheep
"30,000 or more poultry
"5,000 horses in confinement
"CAFO - The Concentrated Animal Feeding Operation (CAFO) designation is strictly a size designation in Indiana. Farms of this size are permitted under the CFO rule, but have a few added requirements under Indiana regulations. A CFO that meets the size classification as a CAFO is a farm that meets or exceeds an animal threshold number in the U.S. Environmental Protection Agencyâ€™s definition of a large CAFO, which is:
"700 mature dairy cows
"1,000 veal calves
"1,000 cattle other than mature dairy cows
"2,500 swine above 55 pounds
"10,000 swine less than 55 pounds
"500 horses
"10,000 sheep or lambs
"55,000 turkeys
"30,000 laying hens or broilers with a liquid manure handling system
"125,000 broilers with a solid manure handling system
"82,000 laying hens with a solid manure handling system
"30,000 ducks with a solid manure handling system
"5,000 ducks with a liquid manure handling system"
descript.purpose: This data set was developed to provide accurate coordinate information for managed facilities and customers of the Indiana Department of Environmental Management.
descript.supplinf: This data set generally contains the location of access points to managed sites, along with a unique identifier for each location.

timeperd.current: Based on metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source shapefile IDEM_CFO.SHP

idinfo.accconst: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.
idinfo.useconst:
DATA DISCLAIMER - This data set is provided by Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey, and contains data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data.
COPYRIGHT 2018, THE TRUSTEES OF INDIANA UNIVERSITY, INDIANA GEOLOGICAL AND WATER SURVEY, ALL RIGHTS RESERVED
CREDIT - It is requested that the CFO Program, Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP: Confined Feeding Operation Facilities in Indiana (Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Point Shapefile), digital compilation by IGWS, 20181019].
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY - This product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.
idinfo.datacred: CFO Program personnel, Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management (20181019)
idinfo.native: Esri ArcGIS 10.6 shapefile format, approximately 2.49 Mb

attracc.attraccr:
This data set was provided by IDEM personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source shapefile IDEM_CFO.SHP:
"All attributes created during the data collection process were verified by visual inspection of the information in the database with IDEM OLQ records to verify consistency. However, no formal tests were performed. Therefore accuracy cannot be guaranteed or verified. Omissions or null values in certain fields are either a result of changes made in the data dictionary used by the program or Section (adding or deleting attributes collected) as the project progressed, information was unknown or mistakenly left out, or the ommission was not relative to the method used to collect the data."

dataqual.logic: This data set was provided by IDEM personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
dataqual.complete:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source shapefile IDEM_CFO.SHP:
"This data set consists of locations of Confined Feeding Operations within the state of Indiana. This dataset is incomplete and a work in progress, as sites are GPS'd as they are inspected. This dataset contains information that represents what had been recorded, processed, and archived by IDEM personnel at a time previous to publication. However the data set may be incomplete and/or inaccurate due to the ever-changing status of managed facilities and sites, and due to the data collection and processing efforts of IDEM staff. It is an ever-changing work in progress. Data were collected by the Solid Waste Compliance section within the Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management. The Section was also responsible for collecting attribute information for each location. The data has been QA/QC'd for consistency but no formal tests were performed on accuracy. Therefore accuracy cannot be guaranteed or verified. Omissions or null values are due to the fact that edits were made in the data dictionary (adding or deleting attribute information) as the project progressed, information was unknown or mistakenly left out, or the field with the ommission was not relative to the method used to collect the data.
"Due to the mobility and short-life of many CFO operations, this data is unlikely to be complete. Staff has had difficulty determining locations for Out-Of-Business sites thay may have been inactive for a number of years. Secondly, if Operators efuse to report their business, it is difficult to be aware of their existence."

horizpa.horizpar:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source shapefile IDEM_CFO.SHP:
"The data were collected with a GPS GIS-mapping system. The accuracy of the coordinates should be from 1-5 meters, depending upon the type of GPS instrument used, the collection environment (ie., multipath, SNR, and PDOP), and the number of positions logged for each location. However, this accuracy cannot be guaranteed or verified. Each GPS unit should have been configured within the specifications of the manufacturer. However, if necessary, the field personnel would configure the unit outside of specifications if environmental conditions warranted. Accuracy was checked by logging both Maximum PDOP and the standard deviations of the positional average of each location collected. If maximum PDOP value was > 6, the value for the "In_specs" field was input as "NO". If the standard deviation was > 8, the corrected GPS file was analyzed for signs of multipath and/or outliers, and edited accordingly. It was then re-exported to the archive. If the data set was uneditable it was still left in the archive. The "In-specs" field was changed to "No" and the location could have an accuracy > 5 meters.
"If the environmental conditions of the collection session fell within the acceptable ranges for data collection as defined by the technical specifications of the instrument used and specific instrument configuration, then the accuracy of the collected coordinates should be within those values as given by the manufacturer. The GeoExplorer Unit has an accuracy range of 2 to 5 meters (post-processed), the GeoExplorer 3 and 3c a range of 1 to 5 meters (post-processed), and the Pro XR has a range of .50 cm - 1m differential accuracy to real-time differential correction.
"If the environmental conditions and/or technical configurations were not met, then the values could exceed those given by the manufacturer."

vertacc.vertaccr:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source shapefile CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS:
"The vertical accuracy for GPS data collection can be two to three times less accurate than horizontal accuracy. The vertical accuracy for these locations could have up to 15 meters of error. However, this accuracy cannot be guaranteed or verified. Height above Ellipsoid values have been recorded, but it is strongly suggested that the values not be used for any analysis.
"Due to the nature of how these values are derived in the GPS data collection process, the error variable is large enough to make the coordinate values unuseable in any type of locational analysis."

citeinfo.title: IDEM_DATA_UPDATES_October2018.ZIP (IDEM_CFO.SHP)
citeinfo.othercit: IGS personnel requested locational information for confined feeding operations in Indiana from IDEM, OLQ personnel. Kevin Miller (IDEM, OLQ) provided a CD-ROM that contained the shapefile CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS.SHP on August 16, 2002. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an updated shapefile and updated metadata on January 14, 2003. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an updated shapefile and updated metadata on July 11, 2003. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an updated shapefile and updated metadata on June 3, 2004. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an updated shapefile and updated metadata on January 4, 2005. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an updated Esri geodatabase and updated metadata on April 25, 2005. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an updated Esri geodatabase and updated metadata on July 27, 2006. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an updated Esri geodatabase and updated metadata on January 24, 2007. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an Esri geodatabase and metadata on June 4, 2009. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an Esri geodatabase and metadata on April 16, 2010. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an Esri geodatabase and metadata on June 25, 2013. Shane Moore (IDEM, OLQ) provided an Esri geodatabase and metadata on February 25, 2015. Miranda Hancock (IDEM, GIS Coordinator) provided an updated Esri shapfile and metadata on October 19, 2018.

srctime.srccurr: Based on metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source shapefile named IDEM_CFO.SHP.

srcinfo.srccontr: Confined feeding operation facility locations within Indiana

procstep.procdesc: IGS personnel received an Esri shapefile named CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS from IDEM personnel on August 16, 2002. CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS was loaded into Esri ArcView 3.3 and the shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN. It should also be noted that portions of the associated metadata provided by IDEM for CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS was extracted and included in this metadata file.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri shapefile (and metadata) named CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on January 14, 2003. CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS was loaded into Esri ArcView 3.3 and the shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, and COUNTY_NAM. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri shapefile (and metadata) named CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on July 11, 2003. CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS was loaded into Esri ArcView 3.3 and the shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, and COUNTY_NAM. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri shapefile (and metadata) named CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on June 3, 2004. CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS was loaded into Esri ArcMap 8.3 and the shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, and COUNTY_NAM. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri shapefile (and metadata) named CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on January 4, 2005. CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS was loaded into Esri ArcMap 9.0 and the shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, and COUNTY_NAM. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri geodatabase (and metadata) named "OLQ_GPS_DATA_IGS.MDB" from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on April 25, 2005. OLQ_GPS_DATA_IGS.MDB was loaded into Esri ArcMap 9.0 and the subset of data containing confined feeding operation locations was exported to an ESRI shapefile format. The shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, and COUNTY_NAM. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri geodatabase (and metadata) named "GPSDATA_UPDATES.MDB" from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on July 27, 2006. GPSDATA_UPDATES.MDB was loaded into Esri ArcMap 9.0 and the subset of data containing confined feeding operation locations was exported to an ESRI shapefile format. The shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, and COUNTY_NAM. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri geodatabase (and metadata) named "GPSDATA_UPDATES.MDB" from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on January 24, 2007. GPSDATA_UPDATES.MDB was loaded into Esri ArcMap 9.2 and the subset of data containing confined feeding operation locations was exported to an ESRI shapefile format. The shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, and COUNTY_NAM. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri geodatabase (and metadata) named "OLQ IndianaMap Export-06012009.gdb" from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on June 4, 2009. "OLQ IndianaMap Export-06012009.gdb" was loaded into Esri ArcMap 9.3.1 and the subset of data containing confined feeding operation locations was exported to an ESRI shapefile format. The shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, COUNTY_NAM and CLOSED_HIS. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri geodatabase (and metadata) named "OLQ IndianaMap Export-04162010.gdb" from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on April 16, 2010. "OLQ IndianaMap Export-04162010.gdb" was loaded into Esri ArcMap 9.3.1 and the subset of data containing confined feeding operation locations was exported to an ESRI shapefile format. The shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, COUNTY_NAM and CLOSED_HIS. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri geodatabase (and metadata) named "IndianaMapUpdate_June2013.gdb" from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on June 25, 2013. "IndianaMapUpdate_June2013.gdb" was loaded into Esri ArcMap 9.3.1 and the subset of data containing confined feeding operation locations was exported to an ESRI shapefile format. The shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: HORIZONTAL, NORTHING, EASTING, STANDARD_D, LOCATION_A, POSTAL_COD, COUNTY_NAM and CLOSED_HIS. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP to follow internal naming conventions.

IGS personnel received an updated Esri geodatabase (and metadata) named "IndianaMapUpdate_February2015.gdb" from IDEM personnel (Shane Moore) on February 25, 2015. "IndianaMapUpdate_February2015.gdb" was loaded into Esri ArcMap10.3 and the subset of data containing confined feeding operation locations were exported to an Esri shapefile format. The shapefile was visually checked to insure that all data points provided actually fell within the accepted IGS state boundary. The shapefile was then edited by removing the following fields from the associated attribute table: AGENCY_INT, LONGITUDE, LATITUDE, METHOD_DES, COLLECTOR_, COLLECTOR1, ACCURACY, ACCURACY_U, GPS_RECEIV, SOURCE_MAP, EASTING, and NORTHING. IGS personnel then saved the edited shapefile as CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP to follow internal naming conventions.

IGWS personnel received an Esri point shapefile named "IDEM_CFO.SHP" from IDEM personnel (Miranda Hancock) on October 19, 2018. IDEM_CFO.SHP was re-projected using ESRI ArcCatalog 10.6.0.8321 from geographic coordinates (World WGS 1984) to projected coordinates (UTM Zone 16 NAD83), and then renamed "CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP" to conform to internal naming conventions of the IGWS.
CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP was then loaded into Esri ArcMap, along with to the most recent version of the previously published data (20150225). The layers were visually compared to record any significant changes to the structure of the attribute table, fields, or values, as well as to the changes in the total number of records provided (20150225 contained 3,437 locations, 20181019 contains 1,837 locations).

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

edom.edomvd: All regulated animal feeding operations in Indiana are considered Confined Feeding Operations (CFO). To be regulated under the Confined Feeding Control Law in Indiana, you must meet the following size of any one livestock group listed; 300 or more cattle, 600 or more swine/sheep, 30,000 or more poultry, or 500 horses.
edom.edomvds: Solid Waste Section, Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

edom.edomvd: Concentrated Animal Feeding Operation (CAFO) designation is strictly a size designation in Indiana. Farms of this size are permitted under the CFO rule, but have a few added requirements under Indiana regulations. A CFO that meets the size classification as a CAFO is a farm that meets or exceeds an animal threshold number provided by the U.S. EPAâ€™s current definition of a large CAFO.
edom.edomvds: Solid Waste Section, Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

distinfo.distliab:
DATA DISCLAIMER - This data set is provided by Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey, and contains data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data.
COPYRIGHT 2018, THE TRUSTEES OF INDIANA UNIVERSITY, INDIANA GEOLOGICAL AND WATER SURVEY, ALL RIGHTS RESERVED
CREDIT - It is requested that the CFO Program, Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [CONFINED_FEEDING_OPERATIONS_IDEM_IN.SHP: Confined Feeding Operation Facilities in Indiana (Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Point Shapefile), digital compilation by IGWS, 20181019].
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY - This product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source shapefile IDEM_CFO.SHP:

FURTHER THE ABOVE LIST OF DISCLAIMED WARRANTIES IS NOT EXHAUSTIVE AS ANY AND ALL WARRANTIES AND CONDITIONS ARE DISCLAIMED. THE ENTIRE RISK ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF OR PERFORMANCE OF THE DATA, SOFTWARE, INFORMATION OR SERVICES IS BORNE BY THE RECIPIENT.
EXCLUSION OF INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL AND CERTAIN OTHER DAMAGES.
TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL IDEM OR ITS SUPPLIERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, INDIRECT OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WHATSOEVER, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR: LOSS OF PROFITS, LOSS OF CONFIDENTIAL OR OTHER INFORMATION, BUSINESS INTERRUPTION, PERSONAL INJURY, LOSS OF PRIVACY, FAILURE TO MEET ANY DUTY (INCLUDING GOOD FAITH AND REASONABLE CARE), NEGLIGENCE, AND ANY OTHER PECUNIARY OR OTHER LOSS WHATSOEVER, ARISING OUT OF OR IN ANY WAY RELATED TO THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE, THE DATA, SOFTWARE, INFORMATION OR SERVICES, EVEN IF THE RECIPIENT IS ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGWS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGWS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGWS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
